snippet: Mario Draghi cited the rising value of the euro as a threat to the region's economy, which investors interpreted as meaning the E.C.B. could take action if it rose too much.
abstract: Euro falls sharply against the dollar and yen after European Central Bank president Mario Draghi cites its rising value as a possible threat to the region's economic recovery; Draghi denies any attempt to influence currency values.
lead_paragraph: Mario Draghi cited the rising value of the euro as a threat to the region's economy, which investors interpreted as meaning the E.C.B. could take action if it rose too much.

headline.main: E.C.B. President's Comments Send Euro Lower
headline.print_headline: Comments by Top Banker Send the Euro Down Sharply
